item.title: Famitsu Sales: 1/19/26 – 1/25/26
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade for Switch 2 opens at 23,428 retail copies sold.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for the week of January 19, 2026 to January 25, 2026.

Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade for Switch 2 was the highest selling new release of the week, opening at 23,428 retail copies sold.

On the hardware side, Switch 2 sold 72,086 units, the Switch family sold 17,515 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 9,766 units, the Xbox Series family sold 693 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 18 units.

Get the full sales charts below.

Software Sales (followed by lifetime sales)

  1. [SW2] Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade (Square Enix, 01/22/26) -23,428  (New)
  2. [SW2] Mario Kart World (Nintendo, 06/05/25) – 13,812 (2,792,701)
  3. [SW2] Animal Crossing: New Horizons – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (Nintendo, 01/15/26) – 11,605 (42,977)
  4. [NSW] Animal Crossing: New Horizons (Nintendo, 03/20/20) – 10,070 (8,353,179)
  5. [SW2] Dynasty Warriors: Origins (Koei Tecmo, 01/22/26) – 8,580 (New)
  6. [NSW] UN:LOGICAL (Broccoli, 01/22/26) – 7,907 (New)
  7. [SW2] Pokemon Legends: Z-A – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (The Pokemon Company, 10/16/25) – 7,496 (1,072,570)
  8. [NSW] Pokemon Legends: Z-A (The Pokemon Company, 10/16/25) – 7,385 (1,595,038)
  9. [SW2] Momotaro Dentetsu 2: Anata no Machi mo Kitto Aru – Higashi Nihon Hen + Nishi Nihon Hen – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (Konami, 11/13/25) – 6,313 (256,111)
  10. [NSW] Momotaro Dentetsu 2: Anata no Machi mo Kitto Aru – Higashi Nihon Hen + Nishi Nihon Hen (Konami, 11/13/25) – 5,845 (308,057)

Rankings 11 to 30 will be announced on January 30.

  1. [SW2] Kirby Air Riders (Nintendo, 11/20/25) –
  2. [NSW] Telenet Fuku-Bukuro (Edia, 01/22/26) – (New)
  3. [PS5] Tormented Souls II (Soft Source Publishing, 01/22/26) – (New)
  4. [NSW] Minecraft (Microsoft, 06/21/18) –
  5. [SW2] Donkey Kong Bananza (Nintendo, 07/17/25) –
  6. [NSW] Mario Kart 8 Deluxe (Nintendo, 04/28/17) –
  7. [NSW] Super Mario Party Jamboree (Nintendo, 10/17/24) –
  8. [SW2] Super Mario Party Jamboree – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition + Jamboree TV (Nintendo, 07/24/25) –
  9. [NSW] Super Smash Bros. Ultimate (Nintendo, 12/07/18) –
  10. [SW2] Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment (Koei Tecmo, 11/06/25) –
  11. [NSW] Nintendo Switch Sports (Nintendo, 04/29/22) –
  12. [NSW] Clubhouse Games: 51 Worldwide Classics (Nintendo, 06/05/20) –
  13. [NSW] Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2 (Nintendo, 10/02/25) –
  14. [NSW] Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake (Square Enix, 10/30/25) –
  15. [NSW] Splatoon 3 (Nintend0, 09/09/22) –
  16. [NSW] Tamagotchi Plaza (Bandai Namco, 06/26/25) –
  17. [SW2] Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake (Square Enix, 10/30/25) –
  18. [SW2] Tamagotchi Plaza – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (Bandai Namco, 06/26/25) –
  19. [NSW] Pokemon Scarlet / Pokemon Violet (The Pokemon Company, 11/18/22) –
  20. [NSW] Luigi’s Mansion 3 (Nintendo, 10/31/19) –
  21. [PS5] Ghost of Yotei (SIE, 10/02/25) –
  22. [NSW] Run for Money: Hunters vs. Runners! Can You Win as Either? (D3 Publisher, 12/04/25) –
  23. [SW2] The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (Nintendo, 06/05/25) –
  24. [NSW] Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Hinokami Chronicles 2 (Aniplex, 08/01/25) –
  25. [SW2] Kirby and the Forgotten Land – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition + Star-Crossed World (Nintendo, 08/28/25) –

Hardware Sales (followed by lifetime sales)

  1. Switch 2 – 72,086 (4,237,500)
  2. Switch Lite – 8,577 (6,844,188)
  3. Switch OLED Model – 3,442 (9,426,911)
  4. PlayStation 5 Digital Edition – 5,524 (1,166,266)
  5. Switch – 5,496 (20,236,153)
  6. PlayStation 5 – 2,655 (5,880,491)
  7. PlayStation 5 Pro – 1,587 (317,955)
  8. Xbox Series X Digital Edition – 631 (25,721)
  9. Xbox Series S – 43 (340,557)
  10. Xbox Series X – 19 (323,926)
  11. PlayStation 4 – 18 (7,930,204)

item.title: Dear me, I was… coming to Switch, PC, iOS, and Android on February 12
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Smartphone
  • Switch

Currently available for Switch 2.

Arc System Works will release interactive adventure game Dear me, I was… for Switch, PC via Steam, iOS via App Store, and Android via Google Play on February 12 for $7.99, the company announced.

Dear me, I was… first launched for Switch 2 via Nintendo eShop on July 31.

Here is an overview of the game, via Arc System Works:

About

A short tale, a long journey.

With a beautiful watercolor touch, it depicts the life of a woman.

In her ordinary and modest life…experience her joys, her sorrows, her growth.

Witness the story she spins in a life woven by those around her.

Key Features

  • A Short and Simple Interactive Adventure – This is a textless game with simple interactive elements. Experience the tale of one woman’s life within a short play time of under one hour.
  • Vivid Visuals Captured With Watercolor and Rotoscoping – A story told through beautiful visuals combining the rich watercolor-style aesthetics of Taisuke Kanasaki and rotoscope technology.
  • Memorable Theme Music and Soothing Sounds – The theme song, “Strange Journey,” along with the many impressive sound tracks, enhances the story even further.

Watch a new trailer below.

Accolades Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/dear-me-i-was-coming-to-switch-pc-ios-and-android-on-february-12

item.title: DO NOT PLAY launches this summer
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Horror adventure game gets a release window.

Horror adventure game DO NOT PLAY will launch for PC via Steam this summer, publisher and developer SCRAP, and developer Fahrenheit 213 announced. It will support English, Japanese, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language options.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

When playing the game, a system error occurs and the screen is dominated by a large number of windows. This is a game that you should never play. Are you ready?

Warning Statement

This game is a copy of the browser game “GeM,” which was rumored to be “banned” on the Internet in the 2000s and was shut down shortly thereafter.

The provider was not involved in the creation of “GeM” in any way, and is not responsible for any events that may occur if you play the game.

Overview

This is a first-person perspective escape game. The player must solve the various games that appear in the game and solve the puzzles to return to the game.

Key Features

The game world recreates the atmosphere of flash games from the 2000s. Experience a mysterious world where nostalgia and reality intersect. In this game, you solve the mystery of the truth.

View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

Screenshots

  • ❮
  • ❯


https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/do-not-play-launches-this-summer
